page.title: 18WAVERLEY ABBEY (continued)
page.content: was carried out but the site was reopened to the public early in 1985. Today,one can see the remains of the second Abbey church,begun in 1203,most notably the West Trancepts,the Chapter House,parts of the mid-thirteenth century monks dormitory and the cellarium. On St. Swithun's day in 1978, a pageant was held in the Abbey grounds to mark the 850th anniversary of the foundation.This was a great spectacle with the local Middle Schools reliving the history of Waverley Abbey. In 1974,reorganisation of Local Government in England and Wales led to the setting up of a Surrey district covering some 85000 acres comprising the towns of Cranleigh, Farnham, Godalming and Haslemere,and numerous villages. The name{Waverley}was taken for this administrative area.
